title: Is loitering in the haberdashers' the true path to happiness?
text:
When Paula Nickolds, the newly-appointed (and first female) managing director of John Lewis, suggested in 2016 that the chain’s haberdashery departments might be downgraded as part of an updating exercise – to be replaced by the racier alternatives of prosecco bars and bikini waxing salons – the outcry was tremendous. Social media went into mourning; an online petition was got up. Passementerie, it turned out, was our unsuspected national passion. So extravagant were the expressions of dismay that the company issued a swift denial: “Haberdashery is woven into the fabric of our business and there are no plans to unstitch it”.

Very amusing. But for the legions who love to loiter among the rainbow...
